summary: The Stomach Cancer Prevention and Early Detection Act (HR 4841) mandates the National Cancer Institute (NCI) to review the current state of stomach cancer in the US, including incidence, risk factors, screening, and awareness. The NCI will submit a report with recommendations for identifying high-risk populations, improving screening, and enhancing research. The Department of Defense will conduct a study on stomach cancer among military personnel and veterans, examining incidence, risk factors, and screening within military healthcare systems, submitting a report with policy recommendations.
